item.description:
Sorry for the short notice. I've just gotten back from the Palm Springs International Film Festival (PSIFF). This movie is:

THE ROAD

(2009) Directed by John Hillcoat. Screenplay by Joe Penhall, based on the novel by Cormac McCarthy. Director of photography, Javier Aguirresarobe. Cast: Viggo Mortensen, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Charlize Theron, Robert Duvall.
Cormac McCarthy's last novel to hit the screen, No Country For Old Men, may have swept the Oscars, but The Road is a more interesting - and Pulitzer Prize winning - story. Sometime in the future there has been an apocalypse that wipes out life as we know it. As fires rage and roaming thieves prey on the weak, what remains is a father (Viggo Mortensen) with the desperate quest to protect his 11 year old son (Kodi Smit-McPhee) and bring him to the safety and warmth of the ocean. Nick Cave provides the perfect musical backdrop to a future gone terribly wrong. "Haunting...the artistry of Mortensen and Smit-McPhee carries the fire of our shared humanity and lets it burn bright and true." Peter Travers, Rolling Stone. 111 min. www.theroad-movie.com
